contentrichtext.text: {{multiple issues| {{Contradict-other|date=March 2011}} {{Refimprove|date=July 2008}} {{unreferenced|date=August 2012}} }} A '''large-sized note''' is a bill of any [[denomination (currency)|denomination]] of [[United States dollar|U.S. currency]] printed between 1863 and 1929. This is in contrast with small-sized notes, which were printed starting in 1928. Large-sized notes exist in denominations of $1 through $10,000. The most common large-sized notes are the Federal Reserve Notes of Series 1914 and 1918. These are detailed below, but are only a subset of all large-sized notes made by the [[Bureau of Engraving and Printing]] (BEP).{{citation needed|date=August 2012}} A large-sized note can also refer to a '''large-denomination''' banknote in various currencies.{{citation needed|date=August 2012}} == Denominations for Series 1914/1918 == {| class="wikitable" |- ! Denomination ! Portrait ! Nickname ! Design on back |- | [[U.S. five dollar bill|$5]] | [[Abraham Lincoln]] | Fin | [[Christopher Columbus|Columbus]] sighting land, Arrival of the [[Pilgrim (Plymouth Colony)|Pilgrims]] |- | [[U.S. ten dollar bill|$10]] | [[Andrew Jackson]] | [[Sawbuck]] | Images Depicting [[Agriculture]] (left) and [[Industry]] (right) |- | [[U.S. twenty dollar bill|$20]] | [[Grover Cleveland]] | Double sawbuck | Images Depicting [[Transportation]] |- | [[U.S. fifty dollar bill|$50]] | [[Ulysses S Grant]] | Half C-note | Images Depicting the [[Panama Canal]] |- | [[U.S. hundred dollar bill|$100]] | [[Benjamin Franklin]] | C-note | [[Farmer]] with [[Wheat]] (left), The [[Roman mythology|Roman]] god [[Mercury (mythology)|Mercury]] with package (right), Women with [[cornucopia]] (center) |- | [[Large denomination bills in U.S. currency|$500]] | [[John Marshall]] | | [[Hernando de Soto]] Discovering the [[Mississippi River]], May 8, 1541 |- | [[Large denomination bills in U.S. currency|$1,000]] | [[Alexander Hamilton]] | | [[Bald Eagle]] |- | [[Large denomination bills in U.S. currency|$5,000]] | [[James Madison]] | | General [[George Washington]] Resigning his Commission, December 23, 1783 |- | [[Large denomination bills in U.S. currency|$10,000]] | [[Salmon P. Chase]] | | Embarkation of the [[Pilgrim (Plymouth Colony)|Pilgrims]], July 22, 1620 |} According to the BEP, the small-sized notes measure {{convert|2.61|by|6.14|in|cm|lk=on}} with a thickness of {{convert|0.0043|in|um|lk=on}}. Large-sized notes were {{convert|3.125|by|7.4218|in|cm|lk=on}}.{{citation needed|date=August 2012}} ==See also== *[[Bureau of Engraving and Printing]] (BEP) ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== [[Category:Paper money of the United States]] [[Category:Notes]]
